sect1.title: Manage memberships
sect1.para: One or more roles allow the association of a user or group to a project.

sect2.title: Groups memberships
sect2.para: A group may be affiliated through multiple roles.

sect3.title: Forge Group
sect3.para: The administrator of the forge links the group on the forge project by one or many roles. Through section «Projet administration/Your memberships/Your groups», edit action «Edit roles».

He can make the group public to all other projects or not. This connection does not create a legacy of roles associated with this forge group to another specific project, ie that the project administrator who has to link this forge group with his specific roles of his own project.

So if the forge group has a public visibility, project administrator can add the group to the project by selecting the roles to assign to the group under section «Projet administration/Your memberships/Your groups», edit action «Edit roles».

Note: A user associated with a group of forge project does not inherit any generic role, for example a user associated with a "validation" forge project group does not inherit a validation role when he will be separately associated with a project.

sect3.title: Group of project
sect3.para: After having creating the group, and under the section «Projet administration/Your memberships/Your groups», edit the action «Edit roles».

sect2.title: User memberships
sect2.para: An user can be associated to many roles. Under section«Projet administration/Your memberships/Your users», press the button «Affiliate new users» , select user to add and chose roles by «Choose the roles» button.
